profiles:
Experience HR Project Manager (Tech) Google May 2015  – Present (4 months) Mountain View Lead, special projects for Tech promotion process  
 
* Streamline authorization and publication of exemplary promotion applications to optimize promotion decisions. 
 HR Coordinator Manager (Tech) Google July 2014  –  May 2015  (11 months) Mountain View, CA Manager, team of 9 HR Coordinators who provided support to 60 Tech HR Business Partners 
 
* Eliminated own role by proposing and gaining VP approval to decentralize the team based on deep dive analysis of the position and team direction. 
* Improved team performance through coaching, load-balancing, upskilling (SQL trainings, process documentation), team onsite planning and facilitation, and process improvement.  
* Team project highlights included: HRBP website revamp; 43% efficiency gain in conducting voluntary exit interviews; complete process overhaul and administration of semiannual Technical Infrastructure Manager Survey taken by ~7k Googlers.  
 
Program Manager, oncall bonus processing 
 
* Processed ~$5M in global oncall bonus payments for Tech employees with 99.2% accuracy. 
* Designed tool with Analytics team to calculate bonuses and streamline data submission.  
* Partnered cross-functionally to improve the global process by standardizing templates, automating inputs, identifying new policies, and determining deadlines for submissions, saving 0.25 headcount.  HR Operations Analyst Google February 2014  –  July 2014  (6 months) Mountain View, CA Program Manager, compensation recovery (six month assignment) 
 
* Processed all compensation recovery requests over 5 months with zero errors.  
* Defined requirements for automating end-to-end process, saving 0.75 headcount.  
* Improved Googler experience: saved 15min per clawback by eliminating signing and scanning; reduced turnaround time from 2+ weeks to same-day. 
* Streamlined process for other stakeholders: ensured proper record-keeping, removed Business Intelligence team involvement, and reduced Payroll questions.  
* Partnered with Legal to consolidate 5 US payroll deduction forms into one, updated all templates, and confirmed Docs as a binding contract mechanism (with improved security over PDF attachments).  HR Staffing Specialist & Project Manager Google March 2013  –  February 2014  (1 year) Mountain View, CA Project lead, Staffing Specialist hiring 
 
* Designed process, strategized resource planning, and led project team of 7 to generate 47 offers (46% onsite-to-packet rate). Other recruiting teams have emulated this process. 
* Partnered cross-functionally to create structured interview guide, and facilitated training sessions to calibrate interviewers on the role and interview process. 
* Conducted 250+ phone interviews to measure Google's four attributes, including General Cognitive Ability screening.  
* Led 73/75 candidate debrief sessions (97%) to calibrate initial interviewers, then created debrief request form in lieu of auto-scheduling, saving 85 employee hours over 5 months. 
* As a side project, mentored and built community for the 30+ newly-hired Staffing Specialists in Mountain View, Austin, and NYC from Q4 2013 - Q1 2014. Held 100+ meetings (monthly group, bi-weekly 1:1s) and hosted social events. Summary A member of the EMEA People, Technology and Operations leadership team responsible for managing a cluster of processes (e.g. HR Operations, Staffing Services, Job Posting, Learning and Development). Continuously driving improvements to these processes (including automation), managing the relationship with consumers/customers and developing a midterm strategy for these processes. Responsibility for a cluster includes people management for team members working in the respective process areas. Involved in solving larger cross functional initiatives to address issues and problems such as data quality and process errors also contributing to the redesign of processes to improve speed and the user experience. Specialties:HR Shared Services, HR Project Management, HR Operations, HR Business Partner, Learning and Development, Job Posting, Recruitment (Sales, Engineering, Diversity), Candidate Management Surveying, Staffing and HR Analysis. Experience Manager, HR Operations (Benefits) at Google Ireland Google November 2011  – Present (3 years 10 months) Dublin, Ireland - Project managing the implementation of the Darwin Benefit Management System from Thomsons Online Benefits in Europe, Middle East, Africa (EMEA) and Latin America (LATAM).  
- Manage a team that provides end-to-end operational Benefits support to employees and Benefits Specialists in EMEA. Manage ongoing operations to ensure high standards of quality customer satisfaction and increased productivity, in addition to problem solving for the organisation by identifying and implementing both incremental and transformational change methods.  
- Responsible for the service delivery, continuous improvement and strategic development of a bundle of Benefits processes. 
- Drive identification, assessment and execution of ongoing process improvement opportunities in terms of user experience, quality and productivity. 
- Partnered with Accenture to deliver Total Rewards statements to ~7,000 employees in 22 countries in Europe, Middle East and Africa. 
- Excellent project, vendor and people management experience; including a deep understanding of how to leverage innovative technology, and a familiarity with general business analytics. Manager, HR Operations (Staffing Services) Google March 2010  –  November 2011  (1 year 9 months) Dublin, Ireland - Managed and delivered a suite of defined services to the Staffing organisation by leveraging expertise in high-volume, high-touch processing to create a stronger candidate pipeline, drive shorter cycle times, enhance Recruiter productivity, and foster a more positive candidate experience.  
- Used demand modeling and robust SLAs/success metrics to determine necessary resources, forecast and measure output, and communicate impact. The team combined speed, accuracy, and close attention to detail with reliable candidate assessment and interaction skills. 
- Contributed to an 120% increase in number of hires from job boards while reducing spend by $40K due to the ability renegotiate contracts, obtain free trial periods and adverts and increase usage of social media channels.

Summary Justin Angsuwat has ten years of both consulting and in-house HR experience, leading HR strategy, planning and execution. He currently provides HR partnership at Google to Philipp Schindler, SVP Global Sales & Operations, who leads 15,000+ employees globally. Justin also leads a small team to drive people strategy directly for 5 VPs, 36 Directors, and their organizations. 
 
Prior to this, Justin spent three years as the HR Chief of Staff at a Fortune 500 company during the largest corporate transformation in the world at the time. He then led human capital consulting teams at PwC for three years, before joining Google as a lead HR Business Partner. 
 
Justin was previously named the Australian HR Rising Star of the Year, and was the Chair of the SHRM Young Professionals Board. Experience HR Associate - Contingent Workforce Analyst Google July 2014  – Present (1 year 2 months) Mountain View, CA Artur joined the Contingent Workforce team as an analyst for his third and final HRA program rotation. The CW team manages related policy, program and logistics at Google. 
 
His role is focused on identifying trends and impacting decision-making in the contingent workforce space through data analytics. Artur is enjoying the opportunity to problem-solve and provide answers by analyzing large amounts of data and building a foundational picture of the workspace from the ground up. He is currently accomplishing this work with JavaScript and SQL to ensure that the relevant data is accessible on-demand and in an efficient way. Talks@Google Leadership Team Member Google March 2013  – Present (2 years 6 months) Mountain View, CA During his time at Google Artur has also had the privilege and pleasure of being a leader of the Talks@Google program. He has organized over 15 events, from intimate author book talks with 20-30 attendants to marquee events across multiple offices. 
 
He has truly loved hosting actors such as Gary Oldman, Evangeline Lilly, Andy Serkis, and Natasha Lyonne, musicians such as CHVRCHES, politicians such as Kirsten Gillibrand, authors such as Edan Lepucki, and journalists such as Brad Stone. 
 
His ultimate goal continues to be to host The Killers. HR Associate - YouTube HR YouTube October 2013  –  July 2014  (10 months) San Bruno, CA For his second HRA program rotation Artur supported the YouTube Tech (Engineering, PM and UX) organization as a member of the Human Resources Business Partners team. He worked closely with client groups to understand their business needs and partner with them in the most impactful way possible. 
 
When he wasn't trying to find out where they keep all the cats, Artur was supporting the HRBPs on a wide range of critical HR functions such as performance reviews, compensation, employee relations issues, promotions reviews and more. 
 
He also developed and implemented programs including a diversity initiative to celebrate internal diversity and the quarterly new employee orientation. HR Associate - Benefits Google October 2012  –  October 2013  (1 year 1 month) Mountain View, CA Artur worked on the Google Benefits team for his first rotation in the Human Resources Associate Rotational Program, a 30-month program focused on leadership and accelerated development for high-potential HR employees. 
 
His favorite projects were two high-impact and high-profile financial benefits initiatives in collaboration with senior leadership. "Project Gringotts" remains confidential. 
 
Artur also worked on health & wellbeing projects to meet the team's mission of keeping Googlers happy and healthy. Highlights include: organizing onsite health screenings attended by over 7,400 employees; remotely launching WeightWatchers Onsite in the Google São Paulo and Belo Horizonte offices; providing analytics on employee satisfaction surveys. Portuguese Language Medical Interpreter University of Wisconsin Hospital and Clinics May 2009  –  June 2012  (3 years 2 months) Madison, WI Artur worked as a Portuguese medical interpreter at the University of Wisconsin Hospital and Clinics for over three years. The interaction with patients was far and away his favorite part of the job. Regardless of whether he was helping a patient with a routine appointment or a complicated medical scenario, it was very rewarding to help them bridge the communications gap and improve their medical care. Undergraduate Research Scholars Fellow University of Wisconsin-Madison August 2010  –  May 2012  (1 year 10 months) Madison, WI The Undergraduate Research Scholars program is one of the flagship research programs for the University of Wisconsin. It prepares future academics and researchers while supporting the research of faculty by involving undergraduate students in research early on in their college careers. 
 
After participating in the program for two years as a Scholar, Artur worked for the program as a Research Fellow for another two years. He taught one of the weekly seminar groups and had the opportunity to develop his own rubric for the 20 undergraduate students in his class. The discussions and assignments involved research and academia across all fields of study. Intern, G&A Staffing Google, Inc. June 2011  –  August 2011  (3 months) Mountain View, CA Artur spent a wonderful summer as an intern on the G&A Staffing team at Google. His introduction into the world of high tech, the internship allowed him to further his passion for technology and to develop his professional skills. 
 
His summer project was to create and implement a training program for over 80 interviewers for the Google Children's Centers. The training program included specifics on how to conduct interviews at Google alongside broader interviewing skills. 
 
The entire internship experience was unforgettable. Cultural Sensitivity Cultural Diversity Academic Tutoring Medical Translation Medical Interpreting Legal Translation Travel Planning Leisure Travel Travel Photography See 28+     See less Education University of Wisconsin-Madison - School of Business BBA,  Management and Human Resources ,  International Business ,  Spanish Linguistics 2007  – 2012 Artur graduated from UW Madison with a triple major in Management and Human Resources, International Business and Spanish Linguistics. He can't imagine a better university than Madison. 
 
Beyond his core classwork, Artur enjoyed taking foreign language classes, including French and Mandarin, along with fun PhysEd classes like Fencing, Bowling, Tennis and more. 
 
Outside of class Artur was heavily involved with UW Rotaract during his entire time at UW Madison. He served in a variety of roles at the organization, including as co-President for one year. 
 
He also participated in the Research Scholars Program for two years as a Scholar supporting the research of faculty, and for two years as a Fellow teaching a weekly seminar. The program was Artur's most formative experience in college, thanks to its unique approach to academia and incredible advisors, faculty, colleagues and students. Activities and Societies:  UW Rotaract/International Business Students Association (co-President) ,  Undergraduate Research Scholars Program Universidad Complutense de Madrid Study Abroad,  Spanish Language and Literature ,  International Business 2009  – 2010 Artur attended the Universidad Complutense de Madrid for a full academic year. During his time there he enrolled in 2 full semesters of Business Management and Spanish Linguistics classes, all of them taught in Spanish and targeted to local native speakers.  
 
While overwhelming at first, the high language and social bar had an enormous developmental impact in his Spanish fluency and in his integration into Spanish culture. 
 
Outside of school Artur shared an apartment with Spanish students. He enjoyed exploring and experiencing everything Madrid has to offer, and meeting students and professionals from all over the world. A regular client for Ryan Air, Artur made the most of his time in Spain by visiting 16 different Spanish cities and 8 additional countries. 
 
In the end, though, he still prefers Barcelona.
